title: Introducing the query interface
content:
## For users

You can search posts now!

Find all kittens here: <http://notes.papill0n.org/?match=content:kitten>

## For developers

Want to find out what posts about cats you wrote in the last week? Here you go:

```go
now := time.Now()
q, _ := storage.Query().
            Match("content", "cat").
            Range(now.Add(-7*24*time.Hour), now)
```

## What's missing/open questions

- default to `reverse` when sorting by created?
- how should multiple matches be handled?
    - the current implementation handles it as `AND`
    - would be handy to have `match=content:cat&match=content:kitten` return all results involving cats *OR* kittens

title: Imagining the ideal routing/request API
content:
There are a few things that we do that are currently... at least suboptimal:

- `r.Method == "GET"`
- `r.Header.Get("Content-Type") == "application/json"
- `/posts` != `/posts/`?

There should be a "pretty"/well-engineered way to do this. I.e., we're going to have to either find a library that does what we want or write one ourselves. Let's think about how the code should look like.

```go
router.Match("/posts", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    renderer := negotiate(r) // if we don't find one, it'll be an error renderer?
    renderer.render(w)
})
```

title: Changing the templates
content:
The templates are now in `templates/*.tmpl` and `templates/shared/*.tmpl`.

After changing them, you need to restart the server to see your changes. If you don't want to do this, you can use [our fork of gin](https://github.com/heyLu/gin) (install with `go get -v github.com/heyLu/gin`) which has support for restarting when the templates change.

There's also a `make` target for this: run `make watch` to watch `.go` and `.tmpl` files and then start changing things!

title: Pluggable storage backends
content:
We want to support multiple storage backends, at least `json` (continuing to support the current data), `sqlite` (or `sql` in general, as the driver is general anyway?). and maybe we can even support `datomic`, which would make Lucas very happy!

## What do we need?

- store posts (create, update, delete, list)
- store users (or at least it should be clear how to add support for users)

Optional/fun:

- search/querying (by date, reversed, by title, by matching title, by content, ...)

## How could the interface look like?

```go
// storage_json is the package with the json backend
storage := storage_json.Open("posts.json")

// finding and updating posts
theAnswer, err := storage.FindPostById("42")
theAnswer.Content = "42"

err = storage.Save(theAnswer)

// creating posts
newPost := Post{/* ... */}
err = storage.Save(newPost) // maybe .Create?

// maybe?
storage.Reload() // == storage_json.Open("...") ??
```

## Questions

- how do we "coordinate" ids for new posts?
    
    i.e. should storing a post generate the post id or should we do it ourselves?

    i think we should generate it, could there be problems with that? (it seems a bit more "go style" to do it ourselves, because the storage backend should just store, not generate things. but i'm still not entirely sure.)
- with the above design, adding users would result in new methods...
